title: Strictly outrage as Will gets controversial bye to next round - but not Alex
text:

Strictly Come Dancing viewers have expressed their anger after Will Bayley received a bye to next week.

The Paralympic star was given a pass after he was forced to pull out of Halloween week on doctor's orders.

Will, who is partnered with Janette Manara, did not perform after fearing he had broken his legs during an awkward jump down from a table in rehearsals.

Presenter Tess Daly announced that under the Strictly rules, at this stage of the competition, Will would go straight through to next week.

However, Alex Scott was not given a bye despite having to dance with new partner Kevin Clifton following Neil Jones' last-minute injury.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing fans took to Twitter to protest against the 'unfair' decision.

One viewer asked: "Why was Will granted a bye through to next week and Alex wasn’t? Unfair to me"

"Tess say “According to the rules of #strictly, Will gets a bye...”. Where do we see these rules then?," added another.

A third said: "Alex should get a bye into next week as well."

"Personally think they should have given Alex a bye as well," said a fourth.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Strictly confirmed that Will was granted a bye under the rules of the show, while Alex had to compete again with Kevin.

A Strictly spokesperson said: “Sadly, Will Bayley was injured during training and medics have said he cannot dance in the show this weekend.

"Under the rules of Strictly Come Dancing , Will has been granted a bye to next week.

"Separately, Alex Scott’s partner Neil Jones received an injury whilst training this morning. Kevin Clifton has stepped in to partner Alex in tonight’s show."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

When it was Will's slot to dance, the Paralympic star explained what happened to him in an emotional video message.

The table tennis champion said: ""I jumped off a table and as I landed I landed with straight legs. I thought I'd broke my leg as I'd never felt anything like that before.

"But fortunately its not as severe as what I thought when I first did it."

"To hear the words 'I absolutely can’t dance' was really gutting for me but I need to recover now and come back even stronger next week."

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: BBC)

Strictly viewers flocked to to Twitter to give their best wishes to injured Will and is partner Janette.

One viewer said: "Was so looking forward to Will and Janette this week and the jive but we all look forward to seeing you next week. Hoping for a speedy recovery."

"Woah gutted about @WillBayleytt . He’s using his knees a lot in his dances : please get better soon Will," added another.

A third agreed: "Will and janette are both so sweet and so humble, im so much sadder than i thought i was going to be about not seeing their halloween performance"

"Gutted for Will and Janette tonight. Hope he's able to dance next week," said a fourth.

*Strictly Come Dancing airs tonight on BBC One at 6.35pm
description: Will Bayley was sent straight through to next week after his horror injury - but Alex Scott had to perform with a new partner
